data.title: Compile Error: Cannot open include file: 'atlbase.h'
data.body:
Hello all, 
I am getting this build error while compiling... 

"18>c:\torque3d\my projects\fpe\web\source\activex\stdafx.h(41): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'atlbase.h': No such file or directory" 

I'm pretty new to building projects from source, so i'm not sure if I should be worried about this affecting my game in the end, as the editor seems to load up fine.

I have manually created my project, per the instructions in the README.md.
I am using commit 480e240
Compiling on VS 2010

Thank you in advance!

data.title: Collada import leads to wrong data in DTS (with second UV or vertex paint)
data.body:
From this forum thread:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/130594

data.title: Pmaterial fix
data.body: Adds the ability of all texture types in materials to be dynamic.  The code checks for the # symbol at the beginning of the string and if it exists it checks for the existence of a NamedTexTarget that has been registered with the name provided minus the # symbol.  This has been tested with dynamic textures and it is working.

data.body:
See forum thread:

http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132794/1#comment-839566

It looks like sortna() and sortda() are backwards.

data.title: Remove hard coded paths pass 1
data.body:
- displaySplashWindow() now takes an optional path to a bitmap file.
- Missing, unavailable and warning texture paths now come from GFXTextureManager static methods.

Please see this thread for the issue and fix:

data.title: modifyStorm bug in precipitation.cpp

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body: When calling modifyStorm on a Precipitation object with the time argument larger than 1, it will trigger a crash in the engine. The solution to this is as mentioned in this thread (http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/80232), to replace mSplashHead = NULL; with mSplashHead = drop->nextSplashDrop; at line 1172

data.title: Leap Motion input device support
Moved platform input event files under new input directory
ExtendedMove class and support
data.body: The ExtendedMove class can optionally replace the standard Move class to allow the passing of absolute position and rotation information from the client's input device to the server.  It is enabled by changing $TORQUE_EXTENDED_MOVE to true in buildFiles/config/project.conf and re-running the project generator.

data.title: New RigidShape method to force client
data.body: New forceClientTransform() console method to force a RigidShape's transform on the client.  This is used when you transform a RigidShape on the server and want the client to immediately transform rather than interpolate to the transform.

data.title: Input event changes
data.body:
- New InputEventManager class.  It will be used by 3rd party input devices to generate Torque 3D input events.
- Expanded the input event signal to include three new floats and a new integer.
- Expanded the number of joystick buttons to 48.
- The input virtual map is now extendable rather than hard coded.
- The input devices types are now extendable rather than hard coded.
- New SI_POS, SI_ROT, SI_INT, and SI_FLOAT input event types.
- New SI_VALUE input action type.
- ActionMap has been updated to work with these changes.
- Removed unnecessary references to platform/event.h

data.title: New console type for Point3I
New ScriptTickObject
data.body:
ScriptTickObject is a ScriptObject that adds callbacks for tick and
frame events.  Use setProcessTicks() to enable or disable the
onInterpolateTick() and onProcessTick() callbacks.  The
callOnAdvanceTime property determines if the onAdvanceTime() callback is
called.

data.title: Expanded signals and journaled signals to support up to 13 parameters
data.body: The current signal and journal templates support up to 10 parameters, but some future work requires we have at least 13 parameters available.

data.title: Fix for Issue #214
data.body: Changed two SI_DPOV references to read as SI_DPOV2

data.title: Joystick POV 2 down is not functional
data.body: The 2nd POV hat on a joystick is missing its down position.  It looks like DInputDevice::buildEvent() in winDInputDevice.cpp is referencing SI_DPOV instead of SI_DPOV2.

data.title: Libraries - Update existing lib jpeg with the latest version (v6)
data.body: THREED-3203

data.title: Update for Issue #209 for updating libvorbis with 1.3.3 version.
Fix for issue #210 for ParticleData sends out-of-range data via BitStream
data.body:
Fix for issue #210 for ParticleData sends out-of-range data via BitStream
1. When addProtectedField used with custom setters, we need to return false, or it will set the value via regular routine after the method exists (change ParticleData::protectedSetTimes() to return false instead of true).
2. The ParticleData::sizes[] needs a custom setter, so the value is clamped in a range of 0.f and MaxParticleSize.
3. The spinRadnomMin and spinRandomMax ParticleData fields need a FRangeValidator, so it auto-clamped in a range of -1000 to 1000, as we are writing data trying to fit the values in 11 bits (as UInt upto 2048 max).
   - The description for those fields needs to be updated to use 1000 instead of 10000.
   - ParticleData::onAdd() should check for values to be in a correct range too.

data.title: ParticleData sends out-of-range data via BitStream
data.body:
A couple of issues in ParticleData:
1. When `addProtectedField` used with custom setters, we need to return false, or it will set the value via regular routine after the method exists (change `ParticleData::protectedSetTimes()` to return `false` instead of `true`).
2. The `ParticleData::sizes[]` needs a custom setter too, so the value is clamped in a range of 0.f and `MaxParticleSize`.
3. The `spinRadnomMin` and `spinRandomMax` ParticleData fields need a FRangeValidator, so it auto-clamped in a range of -1000 to 1000, as we are writing data trying to fit the values in 11 bits (as UInt upto 2048 max).
   - The description for those fields needs to be updated to use 1000 instead of 10000.
   - `bool ParticleData::onAdd()` should check for values to be in a correct range too.

data.title: How-to compile is outdated?
data.body:
Hi

I wanted to compile GIT-Clone of T3d on Linux (Ubuntu). I installed all deps and I'm just stuck.

> This version of Torque 3D supports being run as a dedicated server under Linux. As with a > Windows build you will need to run your project's generateProjects.command file to properly > generate the required make file.

When I run it, generateProjects.command screams about missing commands, which are availible, like echo

michal@michal-F5N ~/Pulpit/torqe/Torque3D $ ./generateAllProjects.bat 
./generateAllProjects.bat: line 1: @echo: nie znaleziono polecenia
./generateAllProjects.bat: line 2: setlocal: nie znaleziono polecenia
./generateAllProjects.bat: line 4: bd skadni przy nieoczekiwanym znaczniku `"delims=^"'
./generateAllProjects.bat: line 4:`for /F "delims=^" %%a in (allProjects.txt) do if exist "%%a"\generateProjects.bat ('

"nie znaleziono polecenia" means "command not found" in Polish:)

So I ask - are compile instructions proper/up-to date?
